title: When try_from argument isn't borrowed but should be, the compiler doesn't suggest borrowing

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
# Steps to reproduce

1. Clone https://github.com/hsivonen/icu4x
2. Switch to branch `with-borrow`
3. `cargo build` (this should succeed)
4. Switch to branch `without-borrow` (differs from `with-borrow` by one missing borrow)
5. `cargo build`

The current output is:

```
error[E0277]: the trait bound `CodePointTrie<'_, u32>: From<TomlCodePointTrie>` is not satisfied
   --> provider/uprops/src/canonical_decompositions.rs:55:20
    |
55  |         let trie = CodePointTrie::<u32>::try_from(toml_data.trie);
    |                    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ the trait `From<TomlCodePointTrie>` is not implemented for `CodePointTrie<'_, u32>`
    |
    = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `Into<CodePointTrie<'_, u32>>` for `TomlCodePointTrie`
note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `TryFrom<TomlCodePointTrie>` for `CodePointTrie<'_, u32>`
   --> provider/uprops/src/codepointtrie.rs:53:20
    |
53  | impl<T: TrieValue> TryFrom<&TomlCodePointTrie>
    |                    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
54  |     for CodePointTrie<'static, T>
    |         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
note: required by `try_from`
```

Ideally the output should look like:

Propose adding a borrow to the argument of `try_from`.
